intro: Hieracium scandinavicum, commonly known as the Scandinavian hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to northern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. It produces yellow flowers with dark centers and has serrated, lance-shaped leaves. Hieracium scandinavicum is known for its ability to thrive in cooler climates and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions.
